answerText: Java Virtual Machine (or JVM)[10] This term describes the way type-checking happens in the Java programming language. This kind of type-checking happens at compile time, in contrast to "dynamic" type-checking, which happens at runtime.
heading: DEES |2014 | McGill + Penn B | 11 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions related to the Da Vinci Machine, or the Multi Language Virtual Machine, which gives support for dynamic programming languages.  [10] The Da Vinci Machine is a project completed by Sun Microsystems to extend the "virtual machine" named for this language. The most noted change is the addition to that virtual machine of the "invokedynamic" instruction to give custom linkage behavior to a dynamic call site.
